name: rice production, basmati | rice, basmati | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19908/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of Rice Basmati during May- October, 2016 at a farm located in Village-Sawant, District-Kurukshetra of Harayana. In this area, fields are irrigated with ground water using electric pump for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 4000 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 29-July, 2016 and harvesting date is 02-October, 2016. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 137.5-57.5-84 kg/ha. Herbicides used has active ingredient of Butachlor 750g/ha, Insecticides used has active ingredients of Chlorpyrifos 500g/ha, Chlorantraniliprole 4.8g/ha, and Fenpropathrin 775g/ha. Active ingredient proxies used are: Alachlor for Butachlor, Clothianidin for Chlorantraniliprole, and Deltamethrin for Fenpropathrin. Machinery is used only for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 44.93 kg/ha using plough, rotary cultivator for soil tillage and other activities.   

This activity starts about four weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in first week of May and sowing of seeds started about eight weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 3 months.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Basmati Rice plant. Thereafter the field is prepared for cultivation of the next crop.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0112:Growing of rice

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 04-May, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 02-October, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 100 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Rice Basmati follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process. Number of wet days have been taken for neighboring region (New Delhi) and rainfall data is Normal rainfall for Haryana State in India where the farm is located. The data has been approximated using Wheat a proxy since the tool at this stage could not support non existing crops in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'rice' is calculated to be circa 6.98E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.40E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.
Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.

The total water (blue + green) used for the production of 1 kg of paddy rice in India is 1.903 m3, where blue water is 0.826 m3 and green water is 1.077 m3. For irrigation only blue water is considered. Therefore, 0.826 m3/kg paddy rice.
Source: Chapagain, A.K., Hoekstra, A.Y. (2010). The green, blue and grey water footprint of rice from both a production and consumption perspective. Value of Water Research Report Series No. 40. Accessed on 20231020: https://www.waterfootprint.org/resources/Report40-WaterFootprintRice.pdf

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of rice is calculated to be circa 1.70E-02 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified', 'cyclic N-compound', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'pyrethroid-compound', 'zinc monosulfate'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.40E-02 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
